intro: Richella montana, commonly known as the mountain richella, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its limited range and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
